author: Special Correspondent
text:
More than 40 couples from different walks of life displayed their talents at the Jodi No. 1 competitions brought up by the JCI Salem Metro to mark Valentine’s Day here on Sunday.

The couples participated in various games which brought out the details of understanding between them, chemistry workout between them, memory power, and the love and affection among them.

They were given a questionnaire, the replies of which reflected their successful career.

Manju Ananth, national trainer of the Junior Chamber India, was the resource person.

V. Raja and Priya won the title, followed by Dineshraj and Saranya.

The third place went to P.S. Balamurugan and Renu. A Tamil debate followed.

Gomathi, lecturer, Thiyagaraja Polytechnic College and Gopinath, a government school teacher, participated in the debate.

K. Saravanakumar, president, JCI Salem Metro, was the moderator.

Rajendra Dhanji, former president of JCI Salem Metro, was the chief guest at the valediction.
title: Best couple awarded
